lexUnit.name: sharp.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having an edge or point able to cut or pierce something.

sentence.text: A much more satisfactory method is to reduce the bushy foliage by about a third with a sharp knife or a pair of scissors .
Ask an adult ( not mum ! ) to help you cut the melon in half using a sharp knife on a chopping board .
Use a very sharp small knife .
With a very sharp knife , cut along the backbone and work along the bones cutting the skin and meat away in one piece .
A hidden mechanism activates , ejecting a series of sharp knife blades threatening to push him from the ledge .
` Sixty-four thousand people applied to get on the last series and most of the letters were written in crayon because they 're not allowed to use sharp instruments .
I then removed every knife and sharp instrument from the kitchen drawer .
With a sharp instrument , make six corresponding holes in the bottom of the second cake drum ( the ` roof " ) .
Billy used his penknife to fashion a needle sharp point on each of the sticks .
THE ANIMAL WORLD is so full of savage teeth , sharp claws and pointed horns that many species have sought protection behind a powerful wall of body armour .

There must be some hidden sexual factor involved , as though the soft-furred ( and therefore sexy ) cat has come to stand for sexual violence and rape , via its savagely sharp claws and canine teeth .
Tom 's work mostly involves checking for sharp teeth and rasping them smooth .
The sides and floor of the excavation should also be checked for the presence of any sharp stones or roots which , if found , should be removed .
With one hand she cleared away from under her the sharp stones of the unpaved road .
Cut out the blind with sharp scissors on the marked lines and/or against the zig-zag stitching .
Use very sharp , fine pins ( or needles ) , and very sharp scissors when handling these lightweight materials to prevent snagging the fine threads and puckering the fabric .
The knife was sharper than she 'd allowed , and soon blood was spurting over the tablecloth with each heartbeat .
I would have murdered her if the knife had been sharper .
These blades are horribly sharp , so sharp in fact that one form has not needed sharpening in eight years and has cut around 200,000 straps !
The point is unrelenting and sharp .
The point was quite sharp , although not as sharp as sable , but as I work quite quickly , I could load the brush fully .
He had a vicious gash on the back of his head as if he had been blown backwards against a very hard , very sharp object . "
` Indeed , sergeant , and extremely sharp .
Is the sword very sharp ? "
It was extremely sharp .
A searching , frantic hand savagely grasped Maggie 's hip , and she yelped as sharp nails pierced her skin .
She seemed to be almost floating and Maggie was astounded that the sharp stones had not given her enough pain to waken her .
I have also stressed that research is a powerful tool but like all sharp instruments can do harm as well as good if not properly used .

Be systematic with your inspection : test all easily accessible timbers with a sharp screwdriver to detect concealed tunnels and boreholes ; lift some carpets and where possible a section of floorboards , and test the joists .
